Lego Mindstorms

EV3 Lego Mindstorms Project

The Challenge

This was the final project that had to be completed for the completion of my Certificate IV in Information Technology. For this project, we were given the challenge of programming a Lego Mindstorms EV3 robot to be able to go to a specific corner in a demo environment. These corners were based on colour, yellow and black, black and red, red and blue, and blue and yellow. To achieve this we had a robot we could program to move forward, turn and reverse as well as detect colour and distance. However, both of these sensors had limitations, the distance sensor had a minimum and maximum distance it could accurately detect and the colour sensor could only accurately detect the correct colour from a specific distance.

The Solution

To overcome these limitations, my team decided to first limit the movement of the robot to small increments of a few centremeters at a time, after this command we set a command to detect distance, if the robot did not detect the distance we could accurately detect colour from the robot would make another movement forward. Between every movement we also added a command for the robot to sleep for one second, this made bugs much easier to detect and solve as we went. When the robot reached the distance to the wall where it could accurately detect colour we set the robot to make large or small turns based on the colour it detected and where it needed to be. If the robot needed to be in the Red and Black corner the robot would make a small turn left if it detected black, a small turn right if it detected red, a large turn right if it detected blue, and a large turn left if it detected yellow.
